segment.source: CONFIGURE PACKAGE
segment.target: CONFIGURE PACKAGE

segment.source: CONFIGURE PACKAGE
segment.target: CONFIGURE PACKAGE

segment.source: CONFIGURE PACKAGE
segment.target: CONFIGURE PACKAGE

segment.source: Enables the user to change a package manifest file, package source, load trigger types, or load target for a package.
segment.target: Enables the user to change a package manifest file, package source, load trigger types, or load target for a package.

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: PACKAGE:package-name
segment.target: PACKAGE:package-name

segment.source: User-visible and user-friendly name for the package.
segment.target: User-visible and user-friendly name for the package.

segment.source: /MANIFEST manifest-path
segment.target: /MANIFEST manifest-path

segment.source: The path or URL of the manifest file that lists the applications included in the package and all of their publishing information.
segment.target: The path or URL of the manifest file that lists the applications included in the package and all of their publishing information.

segment.source: /OVERRIDEURL URL
segment.target: /OVERRIDEURL URL

segment.source: The location of the package's SFT file.
segment.target: The location of the package's SFT file.

segment.source: /AUTOLOADNEVER
segment.target: /AUTOLOADNEVER

segment.source: Background loading is turned off for the package.
segment.target: Background loading is turned off for the package.

segment.source: /AUTOLOADONREFRESH
segment.target: /AUTOLOADONREFRESH

segment.source: Background loading is performed after a publishing refresh.
segment.target: Background loading is performed after a publishing refresh.

segment.source: /AUTOLOADONLOGIN
segment.target: /AUTOLOADONLOGIN

segment.source: Background loading is performed when a user logs in.
segment.target: Background loading is performed when a user logs in.

segment.source: /AUTOLOADONLAUNCH
segment.target: /AUTOLOADONLAUNCH

segment.source: Background loading is performed after a user starts an application from the package.
segment.target: Background loading is performed after a user starts an application from the package.

segment.source: /AUTOLOADTARGET target
segment.target: /AUTOLOADTARGET target

segment.source: Indicates which applications from the package will be autoloaded.
segment.target: Indicates which applications from the package will be autoloaded.

segment.source: NONE
segment.target: NONE

segment.source: No autoloading will be performed despite the presence of any /AUTOLOADONxxx flags.
segment.target: No autoloading will be performed despite the presence of any /AUTOLOADONxxx flags.

segment.source: ALL
segment.target: ALL

segment.source: If an autoload trigger is enabled, all applications in the package will be loaded into cache regardless of whether they have ever been launched.
segment.target: If an autoload trigger is enabled, all applications in the package will be loaded into cache regardless of whether they have ever been launched.

segment.source: PREVUSED
segment.target: PREVUSED

segment.source: If an autoload trigger is enabled, the package will load if any applications in this package have previously been started by a user.
segment.target: If an autoload trigger is enabled, the package will load if any applications in this package have previously been started by a user.

segment.source: /LOG
segment.target: /LOG

segment.source: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name.
segment.target: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name.

segment.source: /CONSOLE
segment.target: /CONSOLE

segment.source: If specified, output is presented in the active console window (default).
segment.target: If specified, output is presented in the active console window (default).

segment.source: /GUI
segment.target: /GUI

segment.source: If specified, output is presented in a Windows dialog box.
segment.target: If specified, output is presented in a Windows dialog box.

segment.source: For version 4.6, the following option has been added.
segment.target: For version 4.6, the following option has been added.

segment.source: /LOGU
segment.target: /LOGU

segment.source: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name in UNICODE format.
segment.target: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name in UNICODE format.

segment.source: For version 4.6 SP2, the following option has been added.
segment.target: For version 4.6 SP2, the following option has been added.

segment.source: [/NO-UPDATE-FTA-SHORTCUT {TRUE|FALSE} {/GLOBAL}]
segment.target: [/NO-UPDATE-FTA-SHORTCUT {TRUE|FALSE} {/GLOBAL}]

segment.source: If set to TRUE, a registry value is created for the package, either per user, or globally if the /GLOBAL flag is specified.
segment.target: If set to TRUE, a registry value is created for the package, either per user, or globally if the /GLOBAL flag is specified.

segment.source: If set to FALSE, the registry value is removed and the file type associations (FTA) for the package are reinstalled.
segment.target: If set to FALSE, the registry value is removed and the file type associations (FTA) for the package are reinstalled.

segment.source: If not specified, normal FTA and shortcut publishing behavior occurs.
segment.target: If not specified, normal FTA and shortcut publishing behavior occurs.

segment.source: If you perform any subsequent publishing refresh operations on the App-V 4.6 SP2 client, the shortcuts and FTAs for packages that have this registry value set will not be changed, and the shortcuts and FTAs will not be registered at system startup or user login unless you reset the flag.
segment.target: If you perform any subsequent publishing refresh operations on the App-V 4.6 SP2 client, the shortcuts and FTAs for packages that have this registry value set will not be changed, and the shortcuts and FTAs will not be registered at system startup or user login unless you reset the flag.

segment.source: /GLOBAL
segment.target: /GLOBAL

segment.source: Works in conjunction with the /NO-UPDATE-FTA-SHORTCUT flag.
segment.target: Works in conjunction with the /NO-UPDATE-FTA-SHORTCUT flag.

segment.source: If the /GLOBAL flag is present, it indicates that a registry value will be created for that package for all users.
segment.target: If the /GLOBAL flag is present, it indicates that a registry value will be created for that package for all users.

segment.source: By default, the registry value is created only for this user.
segment.target: By default, the registry value is created only for this user.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: SFTMIME Command Reference
